column5: Looks like we will be taking 71 up to Eagle Lake this year, mostly because of medical issues as opposed to the road conditions. So my question is what small towns along the route have public restrooms? Thanks
Youll be driving through a huge bathroom narda.but you will be going through nester falls and sioux narrows.after that theres nothing till you get to vermilion bay.its a bit longer of a drive.
Thanks. I've already checked the maps, was just wondering if there was some other stops that don't show on the maps.
There is a gas station just south of highway 17.
There is a rest stop on hwy 17.about halfway from 71towards vermilion bay on dixie lake it has bathrooms.
There are lots of resorts on the way up to 17. I guess if the need were dire enough you could always pull into one of the resorts. They have offices and restaurants.

Other than what's been said 71 has a shoulder to pull over on if there's a emergency bathroom stop needed. I've taken 71 for the passed few years for the same reasons. Only 10-15 minutes longer drive and more places to get off the road. Have a great trip.
Also on 71 there are a few overlooks that have pit toilets. Also Rushing River Park and a few convenience stores, etc.Longest stretch without a restroom should be no more than 30 miles or so.
Thanks for all the replies. We did take 71 both ways, it's a nicer drive with places to stop. We will be taking the 71 on future trips.
